summary: This is a memorandum from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York dated August 12, 2019, documenting information passed between staff regarding inmate movements. It notes that inmate Jeffrey Epstein would need a cellmate upon returning from an attorney visit, and that inmate Reyes might not return from a trip to the WAB (likely the Washington Avenue Building or a similar facility).

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as inmate #76318-054 who will need a cellmate upon returning from an attorney visit.

persons.name: Reyes
persons.context: Mentioned as inmate #85993-054 who was going to WAB and might not return.

persons.name: Officer
persons.context: Oncoming staff member who received information about inmate movements.

events.title: Information Passed About Inmate Movements
events.description: At approximately 1:50 p.m., staff passed information that inmate Reyes was going to WAB and might not return, and that inmate Jeffrey Epstein would need a cellmate upon returning from an attorney visit.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, New York
WAB (likely Washington Avenue Building or similar facility)
keyFacts: The document is dated August 12, 2019, three days after Jeffrey Epstein's death on August 10, 2019, but references events from August 9, 2019.
It indicates that on August 9, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein was expected to return from an attorney visit and would need a cellmate.
It notes that another inmate, Reyes, was going to WAB and might not return, suggesting possible transfers or medical trips.
The memo is a routine internal communication about inmate logistics at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.
